title: [Large-Scale] Designing Video Game-Based Mathematics Curriculum: A Hermeneutic Phenomenological Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematics Pedagogy and Experience with Digital Tools
context.additional_context: A course where pre-service teachers explore integrating video game elements into mathematics curricula, researching the pedagogical implications of technology adoption through interpretative phenomenological approaches.

learning_goals: Participants design three or more instructional strategies to effectively integrate non-gameplay elements of video games (e.g., narrative, visual components) into mathematics instruction.
Participants analyze problem situations arising from digital technology integration in educational settings and propose solutions using a hermeneutic phenomenological approach.

In a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, design one VR/simulation-based math learning module using Unity or Unreal Engine, operate it for 10 learners over two weeks, and develop a formative assessment system (5-question quiz + observation checklist) achieving â‰¥80% learning outcomes.

resources: Analytical resources for educational video games across genres

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
